newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds edge higher, some see more gains.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds edge higher, some see more gains.

text.p: Argentine bonds finished slightly higher Friday as some players predicted more gains next week in the absence of any key U.S. economic indicators.
"There could be a little rally in the market," said an analyst at a local bank, as the market will not have to fret about any important U.S. figures to knock it off course.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 rose 1/8 to 89-3/4, while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 rose $0.20 to 125.45.
The market has been rocked recently by the changing interpretations over how much U.S. rates will be raised this year every time a different U.S. indicator has been released.
"The reality is that a lot of people have short positions," which could help the market next week in the absence of indicators.
Next week's U.S. refunding could still knock any brief rally off course though, if prices are pressured in the U.S. Treasuries market on the new supply.
In the money markets, call money rates fell to 5.85 percent from 5.90 percent.
